text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem stroke-proc-not-done-reason-cs

This case-insensitive code system http://testSK.org/CodeSystem/stroke-proc-not-done-reason-cs defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
time-window Outside Therapeutic WindowPatient presented or evaluated outside the established time limit for the procedure.
no-lvo No Large Vessel Occlusion (LVO)An eligible large vessel occlusion for thrombectomy was not identified.
contraindication Contraindication PresentA medical contraindication to the procedure existed (e.g., bleeding risk).
patient-refusal Patient/Family RefusalThe patient or their legal representative refused the procedure.
transfer Transferred to Another FacilityThe patient was transferred to another hospital for the procedure.
unavailable Procedure UnavailableThe procedure was not available at the facility (e.g., lack of equipment, staff).
disability Severe Preexisting DisabilityPatient's baseline disability made benefit from the procedure unlikely.
mild-deficit Mild DeficitPatient's neurological deficit was too mild to warrant the procedure.
done-elsewhere Performed ElsewhereThe procedure had already been performed at another facility prior to arrival/transfer.
cost Cost / No InsuranceFinancial or coverage reasons prevented the procedure.
unknown Reason UnknownThe reason was not documented or is unknown.
consent Consent Not ObtainedInformed consent for the procedure was not obtained.
only-mt Only Mechanical Thrombectomy ConsideredOnly mechanical thrombectomy was considered, and thrombolysis was not performed.
other Other ReasonA reason not specifically defined.
technically-not-possible Technically Not PossibleThe procedure could not be performed due to technical or anatomical challenges.
no-angiography Angiography Not PerformedAngiography to assess the situation was not performed.

name: StrokeProcNotDoneReasonCS
title: Stroke Procedure Not Done Reason Code System
description: Codes specifying the reason principal for not performing a key stroke procedure (Thrombolysis, Thrombectomy).

concept.definition: Patient presented or evaluated outside the established time limit for the procedure.
An eligible large vessel occlusion for thrombectomy was not identified.
A medical contraindication to the procedure existed (e.g., bleeding risk).
The patient or their legal representative refused the procedure.
The patient was transferred to another hospital for the procedure.
The procedure was not available at the facility (e.g., lack of equipment, staff).
Patient's baseline disability made benefit from the procedure unlikely.
Patient's neurological deficit was too mild to warrant the procedure.
The procedure had already been performed at another facility prior to arrival/transfer.
Financial or coverage reasons prevented the procedure.
The reason was not documented or is unknown.
Informed consent for the procedure was not obtained.
Only mechanical thrombectomy was considered, and thrombolysis was not performed.
The procedure could not be performed due to technical or anatomical challenges.
Angiography to assess the situation was not performed.
